This website is AudioEye enabled and is being optimized for accessibility. To open the AudioEye Toolbar, press "shift + =". Some assistive technologies may require the use of a passthrough function before this keystroke. For more information, activate the button labeled "Explore your accessibility options".

Pflugerville News


Find the latest announcements and updates

Trash Will Be Picked Up One Day Late

UPDATE 1/29/2026 5 pm
Trash and recycling service is continuing, and routes remain one day behind.

Waste Connections has confirmed that collection routes are operating one day later than usual. If your trash has not yet been picked up, please place your cart at the curb the day after your normal pickup day.

Even if your neighbors set out their carts and were serviced on their regularly scheduled day, this does not mean your service was missed. Please keep your cart at the curb, and Waste Connections will collect it the day after your normal service day.

For example: If your normal pickup day is Thursday and your cart was not picked up, it will be collected on Friday. If you saw your neighbors trash picked up on Thursday, this does not mean you missed your chance, your trash will still be collected on Friday.

If you have additional questions, please contact Waste Connections directly.

UPDATE 1/26/2026 6 pm
Keep the cart out! Trash and recycling pickup are on the way! 

Trash and recycling pickup will be slightly delayed on Tuesday, January 26 so crews can wait for icy roads to thaw and serve you safely. Waste Connections is working to catch up following the ice delay on Monday that pushed pickup back a day for all customers. Monday pickup is planned for Tuesday, Tuesday pickup for Wednesday, and so on. 

They plan to have all routes completed by the end of the day Saturday, January 31.

Due to local landfill closures and anticipated adverse winter weather conditions across the region, all trash and recycling collection services will be suspended on Monday, January 26, 2026.

To minimize service disruptions, all collection routes will shift one day later for the remainder of the week. Place carts at the curb on the adjusted service day and ensure carts are accessible once conditions improve.

Thank you for your patience and cooperation as crews prioritize safety during severe winter weather. 

Stay updated on road conditions at drivetexas.org, follow City updates at pflugervilletx.gov/winter and sign up for Pf Alerts by texting "PfAlerts" to 38276.

Pflugerville PD executes warrants at local business, calls for tips

On January 28, 2026, the Pflugerville Police Department executed search and arrest warrants at Pflugerville Massage & Skin Care located at 112 W Pecan St in Pflugerville. The arrest warrant was for suspect Holt Marshall Field who is accused of sexual assault. 

Investigators are encouraging others who may have been victimized at this location or by the suspect or may have related information to contact the Pflugerville Police Department. 

Speaking with law enforcement is voluntary, and support services are available through our Advocacy Liaison Division regardless of whether an individual chooses to participate in the investigation. We acknowledge the courage it takes to come forward and thank the community for its continued cooperation as we work to ensure safety and accountability of our community.  

Anyone with information is asked to contact:  

Crime Tip Phone: 512-990-6731  

Crime Tip Email: cidtips@pflugervilletx.gov 

Reach the Advocacy Liaison Division: 

Phone: 512-990-6860

Email: advocacy@pflugervilletx.gov

Housing Development Survey Open Now

The City is updating the Unified Development Code (UDC), the document that guides our communitys growth. To support this update and receive feedback from the public, the City will launch periodic surveys to receive feedback on key topics that are regulated by the Unified Development Code.  

The first survey is focused on housing needs and neighborhood character with questions relating to current and future housing options, neighborhood design features, development in existing neighborhoods and pedestrian and cycling safety and convenience. We need your input, so please share your feedback before the survey closes on Tuesday, February 24 

The goal of the UDC update is to modernize the Citys development regulations to better reflect shared goals for growth, housing, and quality of life. The update will make the code clearer, easier to use and more consistent with the Citys adopted plans and values. It will help guide responsible, well-designed development that protects neighborhood character, supports economic opportunity and promotes quality of life.  

Transparency and public input are central to the update process, ensuring that the new code reflects the communitys vision for how the City should grow in the years ahead. 

Take the Pflugerville UDC Community Survey.

Learn more about the City's UDC.

Prepare & Stay Alert

With freezing temperatures expected this week, be sure to monitor the weather forecast and take steps to protect your family, home, pets and car. Stay informed with the latest updates by following these resources:

  • Sign up for our Pf Alerts system for emergency and weather alerts.
  • Get real-time critical info via Twitter Alerts from @FEMA.
  • Visit Warn Central Texas to receive regional alerts, including severe weather updates.
  • For accessible emergency alerts, text AHAS to 737-241-3710 (for those who are Deaf, Blind, or Hard of Hearing).
  • Follow updates on the National Weather Service (NWS) website and stay up to date on local forecasts and severe weather alerts on the NWS Austin-San Antonio Facebook page.

Stay informed and follow all winter-related updates at Winter Weather.

If you need assistance when City facilities are closed, please call the Police Department non-emergency line at 512-990-6700.
